highlights.para: This chapter describes how to use the Accessibility preference tools to customize your desktop.

sect1.title: Opening an Accessibility Tool
sect1.para: You can open an Accessibility preference tool in the following ways:

listitem.para: Choose Applications Desktop PreferencesAccessibility . Choose the preference tool that you require from the submenu. The dialog for the tool is displayed.

Open a Nautilus window, then choose GoStart Here. Alternatively, double-click on the Start Here object on the desktop background. The Start Here location is displayed. Double-click on the Preferences object in the Nautilus window, then double-click on the Accessibility folder. The following figure shows the Accessibility folder:

sect1.title: Configuring Keyboard Accessibility Options
sect1.para: Use the Keyboard Accessibility preference tool preference toolsKeyboard Accessibility to set the keyboard and miscellaneous accessibility preferences.
The Keyboard Accessibility preference tool is also known as AccessX.
You can customize the Keyboard Accessibility preference tool in the following tabbed sections:

sect2.title: Keyboard Accessibility Options

textobject.phrase: Shows Keyboard Accessibility preference tool, Keyboard tabbed section. The context describes the graphic.

sect2.para: lists the settings that you can modify for the keyboard options.

entry.para: Select this option to activate the keyboard accessibility preferences.
Select this option to accept a key input and to control the key repeat characteristics of the keyboard. You can specify the following bounce keys settings:

listitem.para: Ignore keypresses within: Use this setting to specify the interval to wait after the first keypress before the automatic repeat of a pressed key. Setting range: 10 to 900 milliseconds.
Beep when key is rejected: Select this option for an audible indication of key rejection.

entry.para: Select this option to make the numeric keypad on your keyboard emulate mouse actions. You can specify the following mouse key settings:

listitem.para: Maximum pointer speed: Use this setting to specify the maximum speed that the pointer moves across the screen. Setting range: 1 to 100 pixels per second.
Time to accelerate to maximum speed: Use this setting to specify the duration of the acceleration time of the pointer. Setting range: 10 to 5000 milliseconds.
Start moving this long after keypress: Use this setting to specify the period of time that must pass after a keypress before the pointer moves. Setting range: 10 to 5000 milliseconds.

entry.para: The test area is an interactive interface so you can see how the keyboard settings affect the display as you type. Type text in the test area to test the effect of your settings.
Select this option to control the period of time that you must press and hold a key before acceptance. You can specify the following slow keys settings:

listitem.para: Only accept keypress after: Use this setting to specify the period of time that you must press and hold a key before acceptance. Setting range: 10 and 900 milliseconds.
Beep when key is pressed: Select this option for an audible indication of a keypress.
Beep when key is accepted: Select this option for an audible indication of key acceptance.
Beep when key is rejected: Select this option for an audible indication of key rejection.

entry.para: Select this option to perform multiple simultaneous keypress operations by pressing the keys in sequence. You can specify the following sticky keys settings:

listitem.para: Beep when modifier is pressed: Select this option for an audible indication when you press a modifier key.

Turn off Sticky Keys when two pressed simultaneously: Select this option to specify when you press two keys simultaneously, you can no longer press keys in sequence to perform multiple simultaneous keypresses.

entry.para: Select this option for an audible indication of a toggle keypress. You hear one beep when a toggle key is turned on. You hear two beeps when a toggle key is turned off.

sect2.title: Miscellaneous Accessibility Options
sect2.para: Use the Keyboard Accessibility preference tool to set your general accessibility preferences.
You can change some session-level accessibility options in the Misc tabbed section of the Keyboard Accessibility dialog.

textobject.phrase: Shows Keyboard Accessibility preference tool, Misc tabbed section. Contains: Enabling features beep checkbox, Disable if unused checkbox, Import CDE AccessX file button.

sect2.para: lists the settings that you can modify for the miscellaneous options.

para.guilabel: Beep when enabling/disabling keyboard accessibility features

entry.para: Select this option for an audible indication when a feature such as sticky keys or slow keys is activated, or deactivated.
Select this option to enable you to deactivate the keyboard accessibility preferences. Specify the period of time that must pass before timeout occurs. Setting range: 10 to 500 seconds.
Click on this button to import a CDE AccessX configuration file.
